CEO apologizes for "shyster" comments David Shepardson/ The Detroit News San Francisco- Chrysler CEO Sergio Marchionne apologized today for describing the$ 12 billion U.S. government bailout that saved the company as shyster loans. " Sergio Marchionne has repeatedly lamented the fact that the company paid more than$ 1.2 billion last year in interest on its loans. At a industry event here, Sergio Marchionne three times referred to the "shyster loans that the U.S. and Canadian governments made to save Chrysler in 2009. Donald Rumsfeld concludes in his new autobiography that the war in Iraq has been worth the cost and remains largely unapologetic about his handling of the conflict. Had the government of Saddam Hussein remained in power the Middle East would be far more perilous than it is today, Mr Donald Rumsfeld wrote in his memoir, due out next week. Mr Donald Rumsfeld and other US officials cited the threat posed by Iraqi weapons of ADVERTISEMENT mass destruction as justification for the 2003 US-led invasion.
